fields.description:
Anchors automatically rendered with the page name in front of the anchor, eg #anchor name becomes #page-anchor name. This was done in Confluence 2.0 to fix anchor links in space PDF exports.

Unfortunately, this has the side effect of breaking anchor links on pages which are included via the {include} or {excerpt-include} macro in a different Confluence page.
fields.summary: Anchor links to the current page break when included in a different page

fields.description:
The space.vmd decorator is now an inline decorator, so if you try to customize the look and feel of your space by using the includePage macro you will get this:

$renderBean.render($sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.spacekey"), $pageTitle)
fields.summary: includePage macro does not work when called from an inline decorator

fields.description:
Our brand new Confluence 1.4.2 installation is presenting the following bug:

When expanding a page node with children under Browse Space > Pages > Tree View, a 404 message appears below the expanded page node (see attached screen shot).

The "/pages/children.vm" file is present in the file system.

Please advise.

Thank you in advance for your time.

-George Stathis
fields.summary: Expanding a page node with children in Tree View returns a 404

fields.description:
I think it is caused by CONF-2517 - because we get 1000000s of these damn log-messages, it really slows it down.
(our live server takes well over 30 mins to do a backup - and again, I think its firstly because of this hibernate warning condition - and then the pure cpu/io cost of logging these messages (~300 megabytes!))

For the moment, we have increased the session timeout... see if thats enough. Will let you know.
But we really really need to fix CONF-2517 - why are we getting these timeouts?

fields.description:
DWR's encodeURIComponent implementation is very slow, which means that the browser uses much CPU submitting requests to DWR. The browser's own encodeURIComponent seems to work perfectly well on IE and Firefox.

I'm pursuing this with the DWR chaps.
fields.summary: Errors swapping between markup and wysiwyg for large pages

fields.description:
When viewing a labels content, we need to support restricting by space.

When clicking on a label link on a page, the content displayed on the view page should be from the same space as the original content.
fields.summary: Support sticky spaces when viewing labels.

fields.description:
This was revealed in one of the test cases.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new user
2. Grant the user view space permissions to a particular space
3. Delete the user
4. Attempt to delete the space

When the space is deleted (e.g. in the tearDown methods), an exception is thrown, because the SpacePermission cannot be found. Charles discovered this was due to the permission not being removed from the space when it was removed from the database.
fields.summary: Exception when deleting a space after deleting a user with granted view space permissions
All lines of the info block are centered in IE.  Seems to work fine in other browsers (Firefox, Netscape, OmniWeb)

fields.description:
Confluence site stopped yesterday afternoon with out of memory errors.

 Restarted ok

We have setup Confluence as a windows service:

"%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\tomcat.exe" -install Confluence
"%JAVA_HOME%\jre\bin\server\jvm.dll"
-Djava.class.path=%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\bootstrap.jar;%JAVA_HOME%\lib\tools.jar
-Dcatalina.home="%CATALINA_HOME%" -Xms256m -Xmx512m

-params start -stop org.apache.catalina.startup.BootstrapService -params stop -out

fields.summary: Daily backup stopped working.

fields.description:
The space 'DOC' shows up three times as being watched by me. When I try to remove an entry I get...

500 Internal Server Error
There seems to be more than one notification entry for user: myemail@me.com and space: DOC

...this bug is present at http://confluence.atlassian.com/users/viewnotifications.action.
fields.summary: Multiple space watch entries

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce (Firefox 1.0.6, Mac OS X)

* Go to a page with labels
* Click edit
* Click on the red cross next to the label you wish to remove
* Watch the label vanish
* Click done
* Watch the label reappear
* Reload the page
* See the label is still there
fields.summary: Label delete UI non-functional

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

* Open Safari
* Go to any Confluence page
* Click the "edit" button next to labels.

Safari crashes.
fields.summary: Label edit button crashes Safari
Dynamic layer cropping for large images

fields.description: When a page is exported as PDF, the contained image seems to lose its black color (converted to white/transparent). All the other colors render OK. See attached screenshot, original GIF and exported PDF.
fields.summary: Exported PDF - image missing black color?

fields.description: e.g. 6 pages, 1 label on 3 pages, another label on another 2 pages, and a final label on one page, will result in a list being returned that is not in the correct order.
fields.summary: DefaultLabelManager's getMostPopularLabels does not put labels in correct order

fields.description: If a label has been applied say three times, that label will appear 3 times in the list returned by this method (due to the CONTENT to LABEL table join).
fields.summary: DefaultLabelManager.getBySpace() returns duplicate labels

fields.description:
When certain text including smart quotes is pasted into the edit window for a page, and formatting (like bold, italic, strike, or under) is applied to that text, the resulting page will show the formatting macro characters, and no formatting is applied.

For example, this text should be italicized in the previewed page:

_importantSomehow "textInSmartQuotes" importantSomehow_

However, the _'s will be visible instead, and the text is not italicized.
fields.summary: Text formatting breaks when formatted text includes smart quotes

fields.description:
Because the renderer pull-out has changed some of the UI, we will need to add a compatibility layer to Confluence (in the Confluence project under the com.atlassian.renderer package) to ensure old macros continue to work.

We will need to test against:

* The official 1.4.3 macros (just copy the plugins directory over and try to build them all)
* All 1.4-compatible macros in the CONFEXT space

For each method or class that these macros require but that has been moved, we will need to create a deprecated method or class inside Confluence that redirects the functionality to wherever it has been moved.
fields.summary: Ensure 1.5 is compatible with 1.4 macros

fields.description:
It seems that links to pages with both upper case and non-ASCII characters in their titles don't get rendered properly. Instead of a "display page" link, a "create page" is displayed - even though the page already exists.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Add the following link to page X: [title ä]
2) View the updated page X. "title ä" is now a "create page" link, just as it should be. Click the link and save some random content to the page.
3) View page X again. "title ä" is now a "display page" link, just as it should be.
4) Go and edit page "title ä". Change the title to "Title ä" (or whatever, just as long there's at least one upper case character and one non-ASCII character).
5) View page X. "Title ä" is now a "create page" link, even though the page exists and so the link should be a "display page" link. The page still exists (can be found through "Browse space", for instance), but the link is broken.

A workaround would be to replace all links with upper case and non-ASCII characters with ID reference links (e.g. "[Title ä|$42]"), but that's a tiresome task to do. I realize this is not a major issue for English content, but as our Confluence has content in Finnish (in which letters like ä and ö are fairly common), this is a major bug for us.

I think this problem didn't exist in 1.4.1, but I'm not totally sure about that. The problem certainly existed in 1.4.2 and continues to exist in 1.4.3.
fields.summary: Broken links to pages with non-ASCII titles

fields.description:
Hi,

We were running 1.3.x and breadcrumbs showed up like SpaceName > ParentA > ParentB > PageTitle , which is expected behaviour.
Now we just upgraded to 1.4.2 , and, while *newly created* pages' breadcrumbs still behave that way, breadcrumbs of pages that were created before the upgrade just show up as SpaceName > PageTitle , without parents.

Will confirm later today if this is still happening with 1.4.3
This was also reported on the mailing list: 
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257218053
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257218750

(We're not talking ellipsis here, we're really talking NO parent pages names)

Cheers

fields.description:
It really seems like a meaningless distinction, with added complexity to the bargain.

If I give a user the administrator Conf. permission they are not, by default, given the create space permission. Yet, superusers are supposed to be able to do anything.

On the other hand, the administrator can simply go to global permissions and add the create space perm. to their permission list. So, no effective security is gained from the distinction between the two but an annoying step is placed between a new administrator and the create space permission.

When writing a user macro, it should be possible to call an exisiting macro.  Since the bulk of confluence wiki rendering is encapsulated in macros, not being able to call existing macros greatly reduces the value of user macros.  Actually the same issue really exists for macro plugins, since it is not particularly easy to reuse an existing macro plugin from a macro plugin.

Our use case is to have special macros for different jiraissues, like:
  {confluenceissues:severity=5|assignee=cmiller}  which just turns around and calls {jiraissues} with an appropriately crafted url.
fields.summary: User macros should be able to call macro plugins and user macros

fields.description:
We are trying to deploy confluence on Tomcat 5.0 in the "/" context as opposed to http://some-base-url/confluence.

Looking at the tomcat documentation, it should only require us to edit server.xml and change the path attribute of the <Context> tag from "/confluence" to "" (empty string).

When re-starting Tomcat, the root context confluence is loaded with no issues, but Tomcat then tries to install confluence a second time under the "/confluence" context. This second attempt fails with a hibernate error complaining that the declared database JNDI name cannot be found in the "/confluence" context (which makes sense). This second attempt to install confluence is also odd since we are installing the exploded war file and don't have a confluence.war  in the webapps directory.

When browsing to the application, we can find it in the root context. Spaces can be browsed and pages can be edited. Nevertheless, when trying to access to Administration pages, a 404 error comes back.

Below is the <Context> section of the server.xml as well as our confluence.cfg.xml.

Is there a better way to deploy confluence in the root context of Tomcat 5.0?

<Context displayName="confluence" docBase="confluence" path=" " debug="0" reloadable="false">
           
            <Logger className="org.apache.catalina.logger.FileLogger" prefix="atlassian-confluence." suffix=".log" timestamp="true"/>
            
            <Resource name="jdbc/confluence" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"/>
        	<ResourceParams name="jdbc/confluence">
        	    <parameter> 
        	         <name>factory</name> 
        	         <value>org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSourceFactory</value> 
        	    </parameter>
        	    <parameter> 
        	         <name>maxActive</name> 
        	         <value>20</value>
        	    </parameter>
        	    <parameter> 
        	         <name>maxIdle</name> 
        	         <value>10</value> 
        	    </parameter>
        	    <parameter> 
        	        <name>maxWait</name> 
        	        <value>10000</value> 
        	    </parameter>
        	    <parameter> 
        	        <name>username</name> 
        	        <value>********</value> 
        	    </parameter>
        	    <parameter> 
        	        <name>password</name> 
        	        <value>********</value> 
        	    </parameter>
        	    <parameter> 
        	        <name>driverClassName</name> 
        	        <value>com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</value> 
        	    </parameter>
        	    <parameter> 
        	        <name>url</name> 
        	        <value>jdbc:mysql://{our db server address}:3306/confluence?autoReconnect=true&relaxAutoCommit=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8</value> 
        	    </parameter>
        	</ResourceParams>
            
        </Context>

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3730].
  {panel}

In various situations, a redirect would be of significant help:

1. For us, we need to mirror some pages at different nodes in page hierachy (sometimes even in different space).  Right now we make do with "include" macro which is not ideal - it breaks non-fully-qualified links (links without page title and/or spacekey), display no attachment while the real page has several, etc.  A redirect command would help solve these issues easily.

2. For users who complained that after renaming, users of previous page titles would be lost.  In such situations redirect would certainly help - just created a page with old title that redirects.

3. http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Help:Redirect lists other useful purposes.  I strongly recommend implementing it.  Shouldn't be difficult I guess?
fields.summary: Implement Wikimedia's #Redirect (useful for mirroring pages)

fields.description:
It would be excellent to have an offline client for Confluence so that people can work on Confluence pages offline and then resync their changes when they are back online and resolve any conflicts during the sync process.

Workarounds to provide offline access, such as using MS Word import/exports, are discussed at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Offline+Confluence+Access

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of September 12, 2011|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi Everyone,
Thanks for all your feedback on this issue. Over time we've been considering the strategic nature of this feature request to Confluence. While an offline client for Confluence would be useful to many people, Atlassian is focusing its efforts on improving the experience for users who are online and able to access the wiki server. This covers a broad range of uses, including support for a variety of computing platforms and devices. With that in mind, we wish to advise that we won't be implementing an offline client in the foreseeable future.

We believe implementing an offline client to our product would be a good opportunity for a partner or third-party offering. With that in mind, there are already two potential solutions that can help you:

* [Firestarter|http://www.appfire.com/products/firestarter/] by [AppFire|http://www.appfire.com/] (Commercial)
Firestarter enables users to take Confluence offline through a simple USB drive. Any changes made offline can then be synced back to the central Confluence server. [Learn more about Firestarter|http://www.appfire.com/products/firestarter/].
* [RoadRunner|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/19471] by [Artemis Software|http://www.artemissoftware.net/] (Open-source, unsupported)
RoadRuner allows users to take Confluence content offline, make changes and sync back with their Confluence server at a later stage. This plugin is open-sourced, maintained by the community and unsupported. [Learn more about RoadRunner|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/19471]. 

Cheers,
Sherif Mansour
Confluence Product Manager
sherif at atlassian dot com
{panel}

fields.description:
THIS ISSUE MAY BE SOLVE BY [CONF-3724] IF THESE WERE ADDED AS CUSTOM MENUS. However a standard way of implementing plugin config (like with theme configuration) would be nice.

As an example of the page I see changing: http://localhost/admin/plugins.action?pluginKey=confluence.extractors.attachments

I would like to be able to add a "Configure Plugin" link above "Disable Plugin" which would goto a link of my choosing.
I would like to also have a "Configure" link before the "Disable" link on each plugin module.

Note - this additional links would only be shown when the appropriate URLs are provided (much the same as when the theme configuration is shown).
fields.summary: Plugin Package and Module Configurations

fields.description:
There are a few places where it would be useful if plugins could add in their own menu items, to give useable navigation.

Although I am sure there are other areas where menu item plugability would be useful, the following are areas that we have come up against (in importance order):

1. Space Administration - being able to add items to a category ("Space Operations" for example) or even creating a new category.
2. Space Actions Tabs - being able to add a tab to to the list or a sub tab (eg: a new page view along side Tree View / A-Z)
3. Administration Menu - same as Space Administration.

Each item would contain a title, icon and URL (which should expand common variables like $spaceKey).
fields.summary: Pluggable Menus
